comes forward and defends
goes back and defends a straighter length ball. This is good batting, as his aggression in this over has also removed the close-in fielders
outside off and he lets it go
cuts back in from a length, and he hangs back and plays it through the onside
this was shaping in, and took a bit of the inside part of the bat and went uppishly, just beyond short leg!
this time it pitches on a good length and shapes away. Taylor sees it through to the keeper. Some reverse-swing being worked up here

straight ball, and a bit of shape in. Taylor plays it late, and just a defensive push down past the bowler on the on side fetches him an easy single. Critical phase of this match, and a good batsman trying to steer Zimbabwe out of choppy waters
width on offer, and he cracks it away with a fierce horizontal bat. Moor is mixing caution with aggression smartly
he's gone for the reverse sweep, and Rahim goes up in appeal. Are they looking at a referral? No.
short and outside off stump. He bunts it back towards the bowler
straight length ball, defends off the front foot
outside off, and he picks up a sweep towards the sweeper on the on side
length ball outside off, he comes forward and defends
tossed up outside off, and he carves it through the covers. Lofted, but safe
length ball, and he taps it down to the offside with soft hands and calls immediately
this is straight, and quick! Moor doesn't know much about it, as it takes the inside edge on to the on side
short and quick again! This time he somehow manages to get one hand off the bat and play it away defensively on the on side...with short leg looming just around the corner...
length ball that straightens from the offstump, and he comes forward and defends it. Good spell of controlled fast bowling from the debutant here
pitched up, and inviting with the line outside off stump. Moor shapes to cream this through the offside, but loses his body shape somewhat. Just squirts it back down the pitch
HITS HIM! Digs this in short, and towards the body of Moor, who wants to back away, but wears it around his left shoulder
pitches on off and straightens, and just takes the inside edge and runs down to fine leg. Played with soft hands, though
outside off and turning back in, it stays a bit low, but comes on slowly. Moor goes onto the back foot and pushes it down the ground
tossed up, and he walks into a flick. Straight to a man stationed at short midwicket
sweeps from a length, and it goes aerial, but past the man at leg gully. They pick up a couple before fine leg can come around the corner and clean up
tossed up, and he drives on the onside
straighter ball, and he pushes this down the ground to long on

short and wide, and he cuts it away. There's a misfield at point, but it allows Taylor to bring up his fifty. Acknowledges the applause from his dressing room, fully aware that his job is far from done
dug in short, and Moor goes back and then back-cuts this. A delectable bit of timing and placement, bisecting point and gully to perfection
straighter this time, and he defends off the back foot. Inside edge, but hits his pad and falls at his feet
a little short and outside off, he goes back and pushes it through the vacant cover region
straight ball, and he defends away on the onside
full ball, and he flicks this smartly, taking it past both short leg, and the leg gully fielder
outside off and he lets it pass
bowled from wide of the crease, but it is within Taylor's arc. He tees off, and clubs this over midwicket, as it lands just short of the fence
length and straightening, and he defends
comes forward and smothers the spin
comes forward and defends a length ball
straightening from the middle stump, and he comes forward and plays it with a dead bat.
tosses this up and outside off stump, and Moor eases into a languid drive. Well stopped short of the boundary
short, and cutting back into him. Taylor goes back and defends
straighter ball, and he does well to keep a flick down
tossed up, and he swings this around with a confident slog sweep
banged in short, perhaps by accident, but Moor adjusts well to upper-cut this over the slips and run it down to third man
straight and on off stump, as Taylor shuffles across and defends
short of a length, and Moor goes back and pushes this down to long on
length ball that starts from leg stump, and he drives this down to long on
comes forward and defends a length ball outside off
comes forward and defends a length ball. Cannot get it past the man at silly point
goes back to a slightly quicker ball and defends it
comes forward and smothers a length ball outside off stump
length ball, and he plays it defensively to the on side from the crease
straighter and quicker, and he prods it away to the on side with soft hands. There's an immediate call and a quick response from the striker
tossed up, but no great turn on this. Moor has enough time to rock back and defend
comes forward and defends this
comes forward and pushes a length ball on the offside
short and he drives it back to the bowler
length ball, and he goes back and pushes it through covers
comes forward to a length ball outside off, and defends
length ball, and he plays it defensively on the off
comes forward and defends
tossed up, and he drives this through covers. Great wrists, which means the ball rockets away on this pristine outfield!
goes back and defends a slightly shorter one.
starts down the leg side, and Taylor has a nudge at it, but keeps it down. May have taken the thigh pad
fired in at the stumps from wide of the crease, and he dabs it away and picks up a single to the short fine-leg fielder
tosses this up, and he drives it down to long on
angles across him, and he looks to defend. Gets the outside edge, but it runs down to the vacant third man region
tossed up and straighter, and he waits on it before turning it away on the onside with a flick of the wrists
length ball, that he defends off the length
short and he drives it past the bowler through the offside
fires it in a little quicker (84kph), but strays down the leg side. Moor will be disappointed he couldn't get it away through the on side
straighter and better, and he defends with a dead bat
comes forward and defends a length ball
length ball outside off stump, and he takes a step down the wicket and drives him down to long-off
straightens into him, and he flicks it away on the onside
straight ball, and he comes forward and defends
angles this across, and he comes forward and plays it with the outside of the bat. There are no close-in fielders on the offside, though
defends off the front foot
defends off the front foot
ooh, great ball! Angles across him, and holds its line, and he plays inside the line of it. Half-hearted appeal for caught behind
defends on the off side
tossed up outside off, and he drives it comfortably through to cover
plays it defensively
comes forward and defends this
comes forward and defends this off the offstump
holds this back a bit, and makes him reach out to defend this
tossed up, and he comes forward and smothers the spin
speared down the leg stump and he rolls his wrist to flick it away on the on side
comes forward and defends a ball angled across and straightening in
tossed up and pitches on middle and turns in, and he is unsure about what to do. It hits his thigh and drops right by him
shorter in length, and flicked away towards short midwicket. They call each other through for a quick single
goes forward and defends a length ball
tossed up, and he flicks it away towards fine leg
tossed up, and pitches on middle and turns sharply. Beats the outside edge as the batsman looks to defend off the front foot
tossed up, and this time he gets to the pitch of it and drives it down the ground to long off
tossed up, but strays on to the pads, and he has no problem in easing it through midwicket
comes forward and defends a length ball on offstump
short, and he rocks back and drives it towards short midwicket. Smart work from the fielder stationed there
fired in at the pads, and he looks to flick it away, but can only find the fielder at short midwicket
fired across the batsman, and he goes back and defends
bowled from wide of the crease, increasing the slant across Taylor. He goes forward and defends
tossed up, and he allows the ball to turn, and then rolls his wrists to ease it down to long on
tossed up, and he hast lofted this over extra cover to bring up FIFTY!
comes forward and defends a length ball
tossed up, and he drives it comfortably through the off side
strikes him on the pads straight away. Hint of swing back in, but are they looking to review this? They eventually take too much time in making up their mind. Might have pitched outside leg stump
straight and swinging back in. A great ball, but the only problem is Taylor greets it with a ramrod-straight on-drive. All the way down the ground. Beautiful all around!
this one holds its line, just slanting across Taylor. He opens up a bit but plays it away defensively
angling across him, and he covers the swing with a little shuffle, and a dead bat
outside off stump, and Taylor unleashes a controlled extra-cover drive. Does well to keep it down, but times it sweetly!
straighter ball, and he defends it
outside off stump and swinging away. He has a wild swing at it, and misses!
pitched up this time, and he opens the face of the bat as he drives down the ground. There's a man at cover who cleans up
strays on to the pads off a length, and Taylor tucks it away to long leg
straight and cutting back at him. He defends it comfortably
short and cutting down the leg side, and he eases into a push down the leg side. Gets it past short midwicket
short and he digs it out of his body and pushes away to the vicinity of the square-leg umpire
back of a length, leg-stump line, tucked to short fine
angled into the pads, flicked to square leg
short ball on middle, gets on top and tucks to square leg
full outside off, pushes forward and gets an inside edge to midwicket
short of good length on off, jumps back and blocks
full, angled into off, carved away through backward point
full on off, blocked to extra cover
cuts in from a length, drops it into the vacant spaces at cover
leans into this fuller delivery and crunches a drive through the covers
length, seams back into the pads, pushed wide of mid-on for a quick one
good length outside off, pushed to cover
fires it full onto middle and off, grinds it out and gets an inside edge
slips in a full toss onto middle, whipped away one-handed to deep midwicket
another full toss, punched away through extra cover
full on off, front-foot defense
clips a fuller one down to long-on
length, spins away outside off, blocked
full on middle, defended off the front foot
pushes across a length ball that's defended off the front foot
chips a length ball towards mid-on gently but drops short of the fielder
good length on off, defended
clips a fuller one to midwicket
pushes a fuller one to mid-off who dives to his right and half-stops it
reaches out to a fuller delivery and carves it away through extra cover
pitched up outside off, driven through cover who misfields
drills a fuller one back to the left of the bowler
fired full outside off, leans in and pushes to wide long-off
looped into leg, clipped uppishly past the right of short leg
straightens outside off and beats the edge as he plonks forward
full on middle, blocked back to the bowler
rises on his toes to dab a shortish one through third man
gets forward and taps to cover
arches back to a short ball and barely makes an effort to ramp it over. Just lets it hit the bat - the top-edge of the blade -  and that's good enough to carry it over the slips
back of a length, keeps low outside off, backs away and blocks off the backfoot
short ball, directed better this time, goes over middle as he sways out of the way
dropped. At cover. This was so well set-up. A slower fuller ball outside off, Moor leaned in and checked his drive, chipped it to cover, where substitute Nazmul Islam leaped back but couldn't hold on
tossed up, and he drives it through the offside
outside off stump, and he lets it pass
tossed up, and this time he gets to the pitch of it and drives through the cover region
tossed up, and he drives it, but cannot beat the man at cover
starts from off stump and straightens, and he comes down the track and smothers it
goes on to the back foot and pushes away a length ball down the onside
short and straight, and he does well to keep it down with just one hand, pushing it away to the on side and responding to Moor's call for a quick one
banged in short,and he gets up on his toes and places it away past point
angled into him from around the stumps, but Taylor comes forward and plays a defensive shot
short and in at his ribs. He plays it with soft hands, and wants a quick single, but is turned out, and wisely so, by Moor!
slower through the air, and just outside off. Looks like Taylor wanted to go for a full-blooded drive, but eventually just dead-batted it back

short and angled across him. There's an appeal from the bowler, but it seemed to have brushed the shoulder at best. Good short ball, though, and Taylor took his eyes off it as he looked to take evasive action. On a pitch with variable bounce from time to time, that's a dangerous ploy.
tossed up and straight, and he drives it down to long off
straight and slower through the air, he uses his feet to drive it to long off
rifled in towards the pads, and he pings it off through the onside with a flick of the wrists
straight ball, almost yorks him. Played back to the bowler
short ball, and he shapes to cut. Is that a drop? Keeps low, and Rahim can't gather. A potential catch and stumping missed there
patted back from a length ball
down the leg side, and Moor looks to glance it down to fine leg
short, and he rocks on to the back foot and forces it square of the wicket on the offside.
a little short, and straight, and he hangs back on his back foot and defends it dead on to his feet
cuts back into him, and he eases into a cover drive. There's a sweeper who makes them think twice about coming back for the second
short and some width again. He drives it through the offside to the man at the extra cover region

GONE! That's the breakthrough. He has referred it, though.The ball pitches outside off and jags back in dramatically. He hasn't gone too far forward, and there's no sign of any bat involved. It will probably stay with the on-field decision. And that is the case. Partnership of 139 runs comes to an end, and Peter Moor won't have his maiden Test century in this innings
straight ball that he comes down and plays defensively through the onside
tossed up. and he comes forward and flicks it away defensively

some room on offer, and he comes a step down the track and plays it inside out. There's a man at extra cover, but he can only watch as it teases both him and the man at long off. Beautiful shot to go to 99!
length ball, and he comes down and defends
defends a straight ball
straight ball, and he just about jams his bat down on time to keep it from striking the pads. Goes straight back down the pitch to Taijul on his follow-through
short and jagging back into Chakabva, who goes back and plays it away on the onside
short and cutting back in. He defends it off the back foot
swings in, but starts way outside off. He lets it pass through
outside off stump, and the bounce is low on this one. Chakabva has nothing to do with this ball either
comes forward and defends a length ball just outside off stump
shapes in from outside off stump and then just holds its line. Chakabva plays inside the line, but thankfully doesn't get an edge through to Mushfiqur Rahim!

THAT'S HIS CENTURY! It was tossed up, and he played a rather ungainly hoick across the line, but knew there was space to be exploited beyond short midwicket. Knew it straight away, and his glee at getting to the three figures is obvious
length ball, looks to nurdle it down to third man, and gets some bat on it, but can't find the gap
defends a straight ball
looks to revers sweep, but gets it Rahim's pad
this time, he pulls out the conventional sweep, and gets it behind square. Fine stroke!
the full range on offer! This time the reverse sweep, and gets it real fine, too. Amazing control and consistency with this shot for Taylor
straight ball, nipping in, and he defends it away to the onside

starts on the offstump and seems to be straying down the leg side. Hits Chakabva on the pads, and they have gone for a referral for this! Pitches on off and middle, and then slants down the leg side. There's no bat involved, but it has done too much, and was missing leg-stump by a long margin
straighter ball, and he comes forward and defends this

strays on to the pads, and Chakabva plays a wristy leg-glance. The man at long leg seems to have done just enough, has he? Given a boundary, as the fielder's right arm was touching the boundary skirting as he stopped the ball
comes forward and defends this length ball. Tidy spell so far from Ariful, but I don't think we will see too much of him any longer
straighter ball, and he drives it on the up towards short midwicket
outside off stump, and he plays a somewhat ungainly heave on the offside. Gets his bottom hand off the bat in the process, but gets it away to the cover region
on a length and turning into him. He comes forward and defends
tossed up, and he looks to defend. Takes the outside edge, but squirts away past slip along the ground
comes forward and smothers the inward turn on a length ball
lets it pass as the ball is slanted across him
fired down leg, and he glances it past the leg gully
defends a length ball in front of off towards mid-on
length outside off, defended back
full and straight, left alone
length, angling into off, defended off the front foot
slower back of a length ball on off, tucked to midwicket
short of good length, cuts in off the deck, tucked to midwicket

oh, what a catch! Taijul Islam with a stunner! Flat length ball from around the wicket, Taylor senses the opportunity to go big - and who can blame him? That really was a stunner. Gets down and nails a slog. Taijul flings himself to his right full-length to snaffle a stunner over his head. Out of nowhere. How long before the rest of the Zimbabwe ship sinks?
another one goes down. Two in three for Mehidy. Inviting him forward with a fuller delivery, Mavuta plays for non-existing turn and the ball clips the outside edge and sails into first slip's hands
gets forward and blocks off the outside of the bat towards point
full and flat on middle, pushed back
pitched up outside off, defended down the track
looped up on off, defended
back of a length, flat on off, defended off the backfoot
full and looped up outside off, defended
defends a length ball from the crease
flicks with the inward slant to square leg
leg-side length ball, dabbed to midwicket
spins in from a length, tucked to midwicket
back of a length, spinning in, defended off the backfoot
full on middle, driven back
spins big towards leg stump, tucked to fine leg
spins into off, defended
huge shout for lbw, not given. They opt to not review. Seemed tight. Looped up from around the wicket, a length ball that straightens and pins him in front. Was it impact? Yup, outside off
floated up outside off, left alone
straightens on off from a length, kept out from the crease
tucked to backward square leg
clips a legside-bound fuller ball to deep midwicket
length, straightens outside off, shuffles across and blocks
punches a length ball from outside off to long-on
turned away behind square leg
looped across and spinning in from a back of a length, chipped towards the right of the bowler off the inside of the bat but lands short
straight length ball, blocked
nudged to midwicket off the inside of the bat
pushes forward with soft hands and gets an outside edge that drops short of first slip
full on off, blocked
slanted into off, defended
floated up on middle, driven back
looped up on off, gets forward and defends
full on middle, driven back
back of a length on off, blocked
length, spinning in, tucked to midwicket
pushes away from the body and gets an outside edge to backward point
clipped to short leg and hits him on the full on the right shin
comes forward and pushes to cover
length, spins in, backs away and punches through cover
dropped. That's not the first one we've seen go down today. Strides across and flicks this length ball to short leg who can't hold on with very little time to react

tries to flick and gets hit the pad. Taijul is sure he has his man. Mahmudullah takes the review. This is way too high. Hits the back thigh after missing the flick. Clipping the top of middle, so umpire's call remains
looped up on off, driven to cover

Taijul gets his fifth. Or has he? The umpires want to be sure. They refer it upstairs. Flicks this straight to short leg who gets down and snaffles it inches from the ground. Just inches. But good enough. Very sharp catch
outside off, and he eases into an uppish drive and gets it through the cover region
starts outside off and moves further away, and he lets it pass
length ball, moving back in, and he goes back and defends
outside off, and he looks to cut it but plays under the line of it. Goes through to Chakabva
angling into him, and he looks to play it on the onside. It takes the leading edge and flies towards the man at second slip and lands just short of Brendan Taylor
outside off stump, and this time he eases into a cover drive. The ball pulls up close to the cover fence, though
angles across Kayes before straightening into him from a good length. He goes back and defends it
a similar ball, angles across and then moves back in, and Kayes inside-edges an attempted drive down the ground. It goes towards square leg
starts from outside off, and then moves away sharply. Das has a waft at it, before moving out of the shot. Some life in the pitch yet for the seamers
straight ball, and he runs it down towards backward point with an open face of the bat
pitched up, and he drives it on the off. Fielded by Jarvis, who has a shy at the stumps, but Kayes had responded early to his partner's call
outside off, and he nibbles at this again. No foot movement, and hence lucky that he didn't close enough to catch the edge of the bat
short and reasonably well-directed, as Kayes has to take the bottom hand off to let it drop near his feet
angles across him, just short of a length, and he plays it away on the off side
angles across him again, and Kayes comes forward and defends
straighter ball this time, and he looks to play it to the on side. A little uppish, but wide of the man at short midwicket, stationed for exactly that shot
outside off, and invites the drive. Kayes goes for it...and misses!
dug in short, and outside off. He weaves out of the way and drops his shoulders too
lenght ball outside off, and he steers it to backward point with an open face
outside off, and he looks to steer it to third man, but can't beat the man at point
pitched up, but there's no movement on offer this time. Kayes dabs it to the off side and picks up an easy single
length ball, cuts back in sharply. Liton goes back and defends it straight down the pitch
outside off, and he looks to get to the pitch of the ball and drive it, but miscues it slightly. It goes towards midwicket off the inside of the bat
length ball, which he flicks

FIRST BLOOD! Indiscreet from Kayes. It was short and wide from Jarvis, and just right for the man at the backward point fence, Mavuta. Kayes took the bait and went for a cut without getting close enough to the ball. It's a good catch in the end, as the ball was dipping all the time. Speaking of fishing, that's the first wicket Zimbabwe have caught in their net!
short and wide again, and he looks to cut. In the end, it is almost like a forehand dab, past point. Does well to keep it down by rolling his wrists.

what a ball! This pitches on middle and straightens just a bit with the angle, and Das was looking to defend it from the correct length, but just got beaten by the shape away. It clips the top of off stump, and suddenly, Bangladesh are in a spot of bother. Effectively 228 ahead, but these two early wickets mean there's some repair work to do!
this one pitches on a length and nips back in. Raps him on the pad, but would have been going down the leg side. This is excellent bowling, nonetheless
he bowls this from closer to the stumps, and gets it to shape away. Mithun shoulders arms to this one
pitched up, but this time he comes forward and defends. End of a terrific over.
length ball, he comes and defends
outside off, and just keeps a tad bit low. Mominul shapes to cut, but eventually does well to adjust and just keep it down to a dab towards the first slip
outside off, and angles across him, and he lets it pass

ANOTHER ONE BITES THE DUST! It wasn't a wicket-taking ball, to be honest. Just angled across him, and he literally played it through to Chakabva. Perhaps the field placements did him in. Smart catch by the keeper as well! Bangladesh are in a bigger fix than the first innings!
outside off, and this time Rahim lets it pass after seeing the line of it. Pulls out quite late, though...
it's dug in short, and he swivel-pulls it around. Rolls his wrists a bit, and gets it down to long leg
length ball, moving into him, and he comes forward and defends this
outside off, and shaping further away, and he sees this through to the keeper
straighter ball, with a hint of movement into him. He goes back and confidently blocks it
ooh, good ball. Pitches on off stump and has a little movement back in. Rahim knows exactly where his stumps are, and shoulders arms to it
starts outside off and cuts back in. Rahim trusts the bounce of it, and leaves it. The ball doesn't go far from the offstump. Hands on head for Jarvis
outside off, and he lets this pass through
tossed up, and he looks to drive it. Miscues it slightly
short and he looks to cut, but misses it completely. Touch of nerves here for Mithun?
outside off and turns away sharply. Mithun lets this go
this time it's outside off, and he edges it! Thankfully, goes wide of the man at first slip, and that's his first run in Tests
tossed up, and Rahim fetches this from outside off to sweep it behind square. Very well controlled with a roll of the wrists as well
outside off, and he looks to sweep, and gets an under edge. It hits him, and could have gone on to the stumps as well!
outside off, and he comes forward and defends
outside off, and was looking for some movement back in. It carries on straight, as Mithun lets it pass
on a good length, and he edges it, but is able to keep it down, though it's probably more to do with the lack of pace on the wicket. Bounces before it goes through to Masakadza at first slip
outside off stump, and this time he is perfectly balanced as he eases it through covers. A good transfer of weight into the shot, and sheer timing as he pierces the gap between mid-off and cover
angles into him, and he defends from the crease
outside off, and he drives it straight to mid-off
plays a length ball away to the onside
speared in towards the legs, and he goes back and defends
again drifting on to the pads, and he defends off the back foot
Mithun looks to use his feet, and Williams fires it in at his pads. Late adjustment allows him to just dab it away on the onside
goes back to a length ball and defends
goes back and looks to defend, but the ball hits his pads and bounces off to the off-side
outside off, and shaping away, and he shoulders arms
shape back in from outside off, Rahim steps across looking to drive and eventually has to check it and play it away on the leg side
starts from outside off and shapes back in, but Mithun shoulders arms
a little shorter, and again some movement back in off the seam. Mithun looks to adjust from a cut to a dab, but cannot get it past point
length ball outside off, and he comes forward and defends it
nips back in, and hits him on the pad, but the height would have taken it over the stumps. Mithun was opened up by this ball, though
angled in from wide of the crease, but Rahim comes forward and smothers the spin
fired in from wide, and it straightens and opens up Rahim a bit. Good late adjustment to play it down with soft hands
another ball that comes in with the natural angle from around the wicket. Rahim defends
this time he strays down the pads, and Rahim flicks it away, making sure he keeps it wide of forward short leg
Mithun picks it up from middle stump and laps it down the ground. Somewhat pre-meditated, but did well to get his body behind the bat to ensure he wouldn't have gotten bowled
comes down the track, and looks to drive it, but miscues this to mid on.

erm, scratch that.. nobody can ave Bangladesh today, apparently. Well, certainly not if they those kind of shots. Fetches a pull to a back of a length delivery from well outside off. But it cuts into him and cramps him up a little. Can't free up entirely as a result. Sends it only as far as deep square leg. Hey, we're on track for a four-day finish!
good length, tails in from outside off, turned away to midwicket
short of a length outside off, chops a cut from the crease towards cover
reaches out a long way and mistimes a drive to deep point
short of a length outside off, gently taps through point
floats up a length ball on off that Mithun comes forward and blocks
good length, spinning away on off, defended
slides a fuller one into middle, pushed back down the pitch
gets forward and blocks a fuller one into the off side
short and spinning away, rocks back and cuts through point
spitting turn and bounce outside off, keeps the bat inside the line
full outside off, leans into a drive to sweeper cover
full and straight outside off left alone
jags away a tad from a length, left alone
extra bounce from a back of a length, does well to keep it down
fuller of a length outside off, gets forward and blocks into the off side
short of good length outside off, gets on top and blocks to cover
back of a length, slides in, nudged past the right of short leg
full, sliding into leg, gets forward and blocks
full, sliding into leg, blocked
tries to back away and slash at it and gets beaten
barely chips it over mid-off as he steps down the track and finds the toe end of the bat
slid down the leg side, no shot offered
reaches out to a wide length ball that tails away and gets beaten
length ball, angling into off, defended
back of a length, a bit of width outside off, slaps it out to sweeper cover
short, wide, reaches out and cuts through backward point
short of a length, a bit of turn and bounce as he defends off the backfoot, goes off the outside of the bat through backward point
slider, this one takes the inside edge as he presses forward to defend
slides it a long way down leg
gets forward to defend but the ball turns and takes the outside edge before going one-bounce to first slip
looped up on middle and leg, gets forward and blocks
full, tailing into middle, dug out towards mid-on
short, wide, gets on top and cuts to deep point
good length, angling into off, gets forward and defends
length, angling into off, defended to cover
short of a length, on off, shuffles and blocks
flicks a length ball to midwicket
slides this into leg and he tries to flick and misses
short, sitting up nicely on middle, makes some room and rocks back before hammering a pull over deep midwicket
full on off, driven to extra cover for one

full, fired well outside off, left alone
straight through his defences. Short of good length, angled in towards off but straightening prodigiously to shoot past the outside edge and take out off stump
short of good length, gets on top of it and tucks it into the on side
full on middle and off, gets forward and blocks
back of a length on middle, nudged around the corner. Successful over. Bangladesh have struck in the last morning
short of good length, angled across off, shuffles and tucks into the leg side
gets forward and pushes into the off side
full, leg-stump line, clipped to square leg
good length on off, gets forward and defends
short of a length, shifts back and blocks
length, gets squared up by spitting turn and bounce, gets an outside edge to the left of silly point
nice mix of lengths, now he pushes him back with a back of a length delivery and Raza keeps it out
short of a length, angled across at a lovely channel outside off, left alone
full, pushed well across off, reaches out needlessly and gets beaten. This is the sort of avoidable stuff they shouldn't be falling for
short of a length, pitching outside leg, tucked fine off the pads
full on middle and leg, pushed out to mid-on
full outside off, blocked down the pitch
short ball, hits the deck hard and climbs viciously around hi off-stump as he hurriedly scampers back and drops the wrists
back of a length, skids into middle and leg and keeps low, gets an inside edge to the pad
fired a little wider outside his off stump, left alone
back of a length on off, shuffles across and blocks
looped into off, carves it away to point
gets forward and blocks down the pitch
short of a length on middle, shuffles across and blocks
short of a length outside off, not making him play with that line
full, angled into middle and off, driven down the ground
good length, nips away outside off, left alone
full on off, jams the bat down and keeps it out
short of good length outside off, shuffles across and defends into the off side
full, curving into middle and off, driven to the covers
slides a fuller one into off, driven out to sweeper cover
clips to midwicket for a quick one
full on middle, defended off the front foot
good length on middle and leg, blocked off the front foot
length on off, blocked into the covers off the front foot
back of a length on off, shuffles across and blocks to mid-on
short and wide, cut to cover
angles in and pings the pad as he looks to flick it away
back of a length, outside off, left alone

huge, huge appeal for leg before, not given. Going down leg, perhaps. Mahmudullah reviews. Surely heading down leg with that angle. No inside edge as it beats the attempted flick. Missing leg by miles. Horrific review
short of a length and holding its line outside off, left alone
comes forward and defends a length ball
shorter this time, and he goes back and presses it through the offside with the turn
this pitches on off and then straightens into him, but it is short, and he is able to push it through covers off the backfoot
comes forward and blocks a length ball
faster and flatter, but Raza does well to keep it out from the crease
tossed up, and he takes it on the full to heave it away towards midwicket
starts from outside off and then moves back into Raza, who comes forward and defends it. Squared up a tad, but adjusts late to ensure he middles it
straighter ball, and a hint of shape in, and Raza plays it with soft hands, and then Mominul at short leg has a shy at the stumps. Could have been close, as he had come out of his crease to defend!
outside off and then jags back in off a length, but Raza sees it through ahd takes his wrists out of the way in doing so
pitched up, and this time he gets into a good position to drive it through the offside
short, and he goes on to the back foot and pulls it away imperiously! Just one bounce and into the vacant midwicket fence
length ball outside off, and he lets it pass
comes forward to defend, and the ball straightens and takes the outer part of the bat before dropping just in front of Taylor
comes forward and smothers a length ball
comes forward and pushes this with an open face past silly point along the ground
comes forward and sees this pass
comes forward and defends this confidently

GONE! Poor selection of shot, as Taijul tosses this up, and Raza shapes to defend before deciding to try and drive this straight down the ground. In the process, he catches the outside part of the bat and it goes straight back to Taijul Islam. His second wicket of this innings, and seventh of this match!
straight ball, darting back into Taylor, who shapes to drive, and his bat turns and the ball travels uppishly past the man at short leg. Close shave!
outside off, and dying on him, and he lets it pass
outside off, and he goes for the drive, and it just eludes the outside edge. Not advisable for the situation facing his team!
short and shaping away, and he lets this pass
outside off, and fuller in length, and this time he eases into a cover drive. Didn't look to overhit it, and with Bangladesh keeping a strong slip cordon, there are spaces to exploit on the offside
outside off, and a hint of shape back in, but he can shoulder arms to it
tossed up, and he chips this in the air but in the vacant extra cover region
straighter ball, that he presses forward to defend
comes forward and defends
tossed up, and he comes forward and has to play it with soft hands to elude the grasp of silly point
strays a bit straighter, and he can defend on the onside this time
pitches on leg and straightens, and this time he plays it from the crease with soft hands
outside off and dying on him, and he shoulders arms to this
angles across him, but he can push this off the crease through the vacant cover region
length ball on off stump, and he presses forward and defends
pitched up, and this time he hangs back to scoop it up on the off side, well outside the grasp of any fielder in front of the wicket
swinging into him, and he lets the ball come on to him before pulling out the leg glance. Fine leg has to run across to his right and do the cleaning up
fuller ball, that he defends off the crease
comes forward and presses a length ball towards mid-off and sets off immediately for a quick single
fired in straighter, and Moor goes back and defends it off his pads
comes forward and defends a length ball
tossed up, and this time he uses his wrists to drive it along the ground
outside off, on a length, and he goes back and defends this
bowled from wide of the crease, fired in a bit slower and with more loop, but he stays in his crease and defends
the first ball is outside off, and Taylor pulls out the reverse sweep. Rolls his wrists to keep it down and play it past the man at slip. Leg slip and short leg the other two catchers for Taylor
comes forward and defends a length ball outside off
goes back and defends a shorter ball turning into him
goes forward to defend a length ball
outside off, and a bit of loop on this one. Moor comes forward, inside-edges it on to his pad, but it drops short of silly point
flighted outside off again, and he plays a tentative defensive stroke to this. Gets the outside edge and it goes between first slip and silly poin
straigher ball, and he chips down the track and flicks this with a roll of the wrists through midwicket
presses forward to defend a length ball
from wide of the crease, he bowls a straighter one, but Taylor has time to adjust late and flick it over to the onside. Some good running between the wickets to follow that
presses forward and defends a length ball
comes forward and defends a length ball
straighter ball, that he defends off the crease through the onside
length ball, outside off, and he plays this with soft hands. He wants a single, but is sensibly sent back after advancing a couple of steps
goes back to a shorter ball that is fired in quicker, and keeps it out with a dead bat
shorter again, and he goes back and whips it down towards the fielder stationed at deep mid-on
the reverse-sweep again! Picks it off a length, and rolls his wrists to get the placement right, way to the right of a short third man
comes forward and smothers the spin on a length ball
pitches on middle and turns a bit more sharply. He shapes to flick, but can only see it take his thigh pad as it balloons past both short leg and leg slip
length ball, but far too close to Taylor, who sweeps it. Doesn't bother about keeping it down, as he has found the square leg fence
comes forward and defends a length ball, pitched on middle and straightening
tossed up, and he works it around the midwicket region after getting behind the line
wide of the crease, and some drift into him, before turning away. Close to the outside edge, and the offstump, as Moor plays back!
presses forward and defends a length ball
comes forward to defend a length ball outside off
straight ball that he defends back
straighter ball that he drives to long-on
outside off and straightening. He plays off the backfoot and plays it onto his shoe!
goes back to defend again
goes back to defend a ball slanted across him and straightening
plays another angled ball from the crease
Taylor pulls out the sweep, and controls it this time. A single to long leg brings up FIFTY
comes forward and defends a length ball on middle and leg
goes back and plays it away with a dead bat to the onside
length ball, and he comes forward to smother it
outside off, and he goes back to defend this straight down back to the bowler
outside off, and turns sharply, but not enough to entice any response from Moor, who shoulders arms
straighter and quicker, and it just jabs Taylor's glove as he looks to defend off the front foot. It carries a little in the air, but wide of forward short leg
bowled from wide of the crease, on a length, and he comes forward to defend it
pitched fuller, but straighter, and he plays it off the crease with a dead bat
tossed up, and this allows him to drive it with the turn towards cover
length ball, and he allows it to come to him, before playing it with a dead bat off the front foot
beats the outside edge! Starts from off stump and then turns a little more sharply, as Moor plays inside the line of that. Beats the outside edge as well as the offstump by a small margin!
tossed up, and Taylor drives. Ensures he keeps it low as it goes to short midwicket
on the middle and leg line, and he goes back and flicks it
comes forward and defends a length ball
shorter and a little wider, and he plays it away with soft hands
tossed up outside off, and he comes forward and just eases it to covers
tossed up, and his intended drive on the offside his silly point
tossed up, but starts around the leg stump. Allows him to come forward and push it to the on side, keeping it low enough to elude short leg
a little flatter and quicker, not much of turn, and Moor can press back and push this through the onside
shorter again, and wider of offstump, and he can just pat it through the point region off the backfoot
comes forward and defends a length ball
starts from leg stump and then turns across Moor, who goes forward and dead-bats it away on the onside
fired along the leg stump and then straightening. They go up for a stifled appeal, but that had pitched outside leg stump anyway
pushes a fuller one down the track
pitched up outside off, gets forward and pushes into the covers
slider on leg stump, gets forward and pushes it towards mid-on
back of a length, extra bounce as it rips away outside off, kept out from the crease
full on middle, gets forward and blocks
full, looped into middle, blocked
short of good length, cuts in from well outside off, left alone
leg side length ball, tries to glance it away but the ball sneaks past to the left of the keeper who dives full-length to make the save
straight ball outside off, left alone
short of good length, angled in towards off, defended off the backfoot
good length on off, shuffles across and blocks down the pitch
full, angled into middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
gets forward and pushes a fuller one into the off side
looped up on leg, defended down the track
length ball, spins away towards off, blocked to silly point
pitched up on middle, dabbed towards mid-off on the front foot
looped up on leg, defended
length, spins away towards off, defended with the spin to silly point
short ball outside off, gets on top of it and keeps it down into the off side
good length, coming into middle, taps it to midwicket
back of a length, doesn't bounce as much but he arches back and ramps it over the backward point region
left alone outside off
good length, comes on straight outside off, and he shoulders arms
length, spins away outside off, pushed past silly point
gets forward to this length ball, lets it spin and bunts it to the silly point fielder
back of a length, angled into middle and leg, blocked off the backfoot
fuller of a length, curving in towards middle, defended
sliding length ball, blocked back to the bowler
off-side lines, defended into that region off the front foot
full outside off, gets forward and defends
extra bounce off a length, blocked off the shoulder of the bat
tucks this slider to midwicket for one
drifts this flighted fuller ball into middle, gets forward and eases it to long-off

still don't understand these risky shots from time to time but this one's alright, I suppose, because mid-on is inside, and it's a full toss, and it's really hard to not latch onto those. Slapped over the in-field
good length on off, defended
full, flighted onto leg, blocked back
good length on off, drilled past silly point
full, slider into leg, driven to long-off
pitched up on middle and leg, driven to cover
leading edge past first lip. Closes the face after coming forward, against the turn and miscues it towards third man
back of a length, keeps low, punched to cover
so they're not holding back from playing their shots. Alright, I guess, especially if they can trust the turn and bounce. Full, drifting into middle, shovelled straight over
now they're taking the attack to the opposition. Another boundary. Full toss, looped into middle, and carted over the same region. Need to be careful to not get carried away, though
beautifully angled into him and getting it to turn, comes forward and pokes at it and gets an outside edge past first slip's right
clips a fuller one to midwicket
belated appeal from the bowler after leg slip goes up. Misses the ball, apparently, as he tries to tuck it away and wears it on the pad instead
full, slanted across, defended
clips a fuller one to midwicket

now he's gone. Yup, no doubt about it. Moor trudges off. Comes forward to defend and the ball lobs off the inside of the bat to short leg who barely clutches the chance close to his chest. End of a patient vigil from Moor
looped up across off, defended
full, looped into leg, driven back
full and flighted on middle, blocked
back of a length, spins away outside off, blocked off the backfoot
backfoot punch to covers
sliding into leg, nudged past forward short leg
length on middle and leg, tucked to backward square leg
nudges a fuller one to short leg
full, angled across on middle, swept across the line through backward square leg
has there been some bat on this? No, umpire doesn't think so, and nor do Bangladesh as they don't review. Tries to nudge this fine and goes through to the keeper
short, pushed across off, pulled to deep midwicket
pitches outside leg and spins into the pads before lobbing to leg slip
back of a length, whipped away to deep midwicket, pulled back just in front of the boundary
length on off, defended
sliding into middle, blocked off the inside of the bat
fullish on middle, nudged to short leg
looped up on leg, clipped past short leg
flighted on middle, rolls towards square leg off the inside of the bat
pitching outside leg, lets it hit the pad and lob to leg slip

don't know what the necessity was for that. A streaky single! When you're fighting to save a Test! Dabs this towards midwicket, just to the right of the fielder, and calls for a single. Chakabva obliges and he's so far outside his crease that Mushfiq could've run all the way to third man and still run him out. More mindlessness from Zimbabwe.. it has really cost them here. This was not an impossible task. Still isn't
extra bounce from a length, pings the pad as he comes forward to defend
pitches outside leg and lets it hit the pad
gets forward and finds the inside of the bat as he defends
fuller of a length, angling into off, defended
clips a fuller one on leg stump to midwicket
short ball, doesn't entirely get on top of the bounce as he keeps it out into the off side
turn and bounce, short of a length, pushes back and fends at it to promptly get beaten
short and spinning away, cut to point
tucks a length ball to square leg
lets this pitch outside leg and graze the pad

that's gone, surely. Extra bounce from Mehidy, catches the batsman off guard. Tiripano shifts back and fails to keep it down. Gets a glove to short leg. Zimbabwe sinking. Taylor can't do it alone without support
comes forward and defends
goes back to a length ball and plays it with a dead bat
comes forward and defends this off a length
length ball outside off, and he goes down on one knee and laps it around the corner to fine leg. Into the 90s now
short in length and he rocks back and tries to punch this through covers
comes forward and defends a length ball. Mushfiq approves from behind the stumps
defends a length ball on the legside
comes forward and defends
comes forward and defends
goes back and keeps out a ball pitching on off and turning back into him
comes forward, and the turn beats him. It goes off the inside edge, and somehow misses the stumps, and Mushfiqur Rahim as well!
outside off, and drifting away, and he plays inside the line of this
comes forward and smothers the spin on this
comes forward and defends this just to the left of the man at silly point
tossed up, and drifting further away from off before pitching, but he plays it down comfortably after pressing forward
wide, and Taylor lays into it. Carves it away, in the air, but also through the vacant extra cover region
comes forward and defends a length ball
shorter in length, and he uses the depth of the crease to nurdle it away on the onside. Calls his partner for a quick couple
short again, and yet again, he pushes it with soft hands away to the onside. Calls Mavuta across for two. Taylor on 99!

straighter, and quicker, and he gets his bat to it and plays it away to the onside. This is an excellent innings from Taylor. Centuries in both innings, for the second time in his career, and that makes him the first Zimbabwean to have done so twice.
straighter ball, that he blocks straight down the wicket
comes down the wicket and drives it down to long-on. Opts to take the single on offer to bring Mavuta on strike

tossed up, and he has gone for a sweep and top-edged it! It's a comfortable catch for the man at square leg. Taijul takes the catch, and that also means the Bangladesh record for most wickets in a series will stay with Miraz. Perhaps Taijul can equal him, at best!
plays it down the ground to a length ball
outside off, and he goes for a big heave, and misses!
comes forward and defends a length ball
tossed up, turning back into him, and Jarvis comes forward to smother this
straight ball, that strays on to the pads as well. Taylor takes it off his pads and plays it with soft hands to the on side, and takes the single
banged in short, and Jarvis can duck under it
outside off stump and just holding its line, and he tries to get behind the line (but can't!)
outside off, and swinging further away. He lets this one pass, though he was drawn into trying to defend
short, and too short in fact. Goes well over both the batsman, and Mushfiqur Rahim at full stretch!
strays on to the pads, and Jarvis eases it through the on side off the back foot
full, and he goes back and across and smashes it down towards long-on. One bounce and into the fence

Jarvis is gone! It was tossed up, and sent in invitingly towards his off and middle, and Jarvis took the bait and went for a hoick straight down the ground. Ends up skewing the shot, and there's a mid-on halfway to the fence who can jog back and take an easy catch over his head. Bangladesh win this and square the series 1-1.
